intro: Helipterum incanum var. brachylepis, commonly known as the narrow-leaved helipterum, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid regions. Its leaves are narrow and linear, and the flowers are small, yellowish to pale brown, arranged in dense clusters. It is adapted to withstand drought conditions, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
